required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Baby Friendly Initiative Implementation: Maternity Staff Experiences
clinical_study.official_title: Barriers, Challenges and Facilitators for the Unicef Baby Friendly Initiative (BFI): A Qualitative Study of Maternity Staff Experiences

collaborator.agency: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

brief_summary.textblock: This qualitative, case study will explore the experiences of maternity staff in England when implementing the World Health Organisation and Unicef Baby Friendly Initiative (BFI) standards within a maternity organisation.

detailed_description.textblock: A range of maternity staff over 4 UK NHS hospitals will be recruited and interviewed by one chief investigator regarding their experiences of working with the BFI standards in their daily professional practice.

primary_outcome.measure: To identify barriers to the successful implementation of Unicef Baby Friendly Initiative within a maternity organisation.
primary_outcome.description: The aim is to identify themes regarding barriers that are in place when implementing policies into maternity organisations. These will be developed into recommendations which managers and policy makers can utilise to enable change management.

primary_outcome.measure: To identify challenges to the successful implementation of Unicef Baby Friendly Initiative within a maternity organisation.
primary_outcome.description: The aim is to identify themes regarding the challenges that are in place when implementing policies into maternity organisations. These will be developed into recommendations which managers and policy makers can utilise to enable change management.

primary_outcome.measure: To identify what facilitates the successful implementation of Unicef Baby Friendly Initiative within a maternity organisation.
primary_outcome.description: The aim is to identify themes regarding the facilitators when implementing the Unicef Baby Friendly Initiative into maternity organisations. These will be developed into recommendations which managers and policy makers can utilise to enable change management.

arm_group.description: Interviews with maternity staff working within a maternity unit including midwifery managers and infant feeding lead staff members.
Staff working within a local maternity unit.

intervention.description: Unstructured and semi-structured interviews with open ended questions.

study_pop.textblock: Maternity and neonatal staff who meet the inclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
- Maternity staff who have had training in and with experience of working with the BFI.
- Senior neonatal staff working in the maternity unit.
- Maternity unit management.
- Staff in specialised infant feeding roles at local hospitals.
- Student midwives on placement at main study hospital site.
- English speaking.
Exclusion criteria
- Maternity staff with no BFI experience.
- Medical staff.
- Community maternity staff.
- Community nurses and health visitors.
- Student nurses.
